So I got to play him on the PBE, and here are my thoughts:
* His passive does affect monsters, including baron, scuttle, and dragon.
* Autoing a camp will actually get them into the perfect range if you stand still. If you can kite and keep it on them, even better!
* He is, imo, really easy to invade and get a free kill if you go the jungle route.
* His W extends too far to be useful on monsters, but later on it can kill them before you even get to the camp.

He could definitely go top, but I disagree that rito completely ruined the idea or w/e.

Im excited to run this guy as an AP 'bruiser'ish thing with {{item:3116}} ,{{item:3027}} etc. I'll definitely take him Top at least once.

His top and mid playstyle look to be very similar to Karthus's, but with way stronger waveclear. Requires keeping the sweet spot of distance between you and your enemy while rushing that Rylai to make your harass consistency god-like... or maybe even **_Celestial_**.

He seems like a hybrid between Karthus (AoE toggle damage) and Cho'Gath (passive AoE free damage + bruiser mentality). Based on their focus on making an initiation-focused mobility spell combined with uncontrollable lane shoving, it seems like they want Aurelion Sol to get most of his income by roaming.

>they want Aurelion Sol to get most of his income by roaming

And this is the part where Bard's developer being behind just which part of Aurelion's kit suddenly becomes very clear.

Roaming Support meet Roaming Mid Laner.
